stickyHeader.description: Header sticks to top when scrolling reaches it
whenToUse: Long pages where header should appear after scrolling
When you want header to scroll with page initially, then stick
stickyHeader.example: <header class="sticky top-0 z-50 bg-brandcolor-white border-b border-brandcolor-strokeweak">Header</header><main>Content scrolls normally</main>
stickyHeader.logic: Header scrolls with page initially, then sticks at top when scrolling reaches it. Full page scrolls together.

fixedHeader.description: Header always fixed at top of viewport
whenToUse: Navigation bars that must always be visible
Simple layouts where header should never scroll away
When header height is known and consistent
fixedHeader.example: <header class="fixed top-0 left-0 right-0 z-50 bg-brandcolor-white">Header</header><main class="pt-[header-height] h-screen overflow-y-auto">Content with padding-top</main>
fixedHeader.logic: Header is always visible. Content needs padding-top equal to header height. Full page scrolls.

flexboxGrow.description: Content area grows to fill space and scrolls independently (RECOMMENDED for app layouts)
whenToUse: When only content area should scroll, not header
flexboxGrow.example:
Header
Content scrolls
flexboxGrow.logic: Container is full height (h-screen). Header doesn't shrink (flex-shrink-0). Content grows (flex-1) and scrolls independently (overflow-y-auto). Only content area scrolls.

pageWithHeader.description: Simple page with header, full page scrolls
pageWithHeader.htmlExample: Header Content
whenToUse: Content pages where header can scroll away
When you want natural page scrolling

pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.description: Page with header fixed, only content area scrolls (Flexbox Grow Method)
pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.scrollBehavior: Only main content scrolls, header stays fixed
pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.htmlExample: Header Content
whenToUse: When header must always be visible
When you want only content to scroll
pageWithHeaderContentScrollable.importantNotes: This is the RECOMMENDED method for app-like interfaces. Header stays fixed, only content scrolls.

pageWithHeaderFullPageScrolls.description: Page with sticky/fixed header, full page scrolls
pageWithHeaderFullPageScrolls.scrollBehavior: Full page scrolls, header sticks/fixes at top

classes.container: No special container, natural page flow
classes.header: sticky top-0 z-50 bg-brandcolor-white border-b border-brandcolor-strokeweak

pageWithHeaderFullPageScrolls.htmlExample: Header Content
whenToUse: When header should scroll initially then stick
pageWithHeaderFullPageScrolls.alternative: Can also use fixed header with padding-top on main: <header class="fixed top-0 left-0 right-0 z-50">Header</header><main class="pt-16">Content</main>

pageWithSidebarHeaderContentScrollable.description: Page with sidebar, header, and content where only content scrolls
pageWithSidebarHeaderContentScrollable.scrollBehavior: Only main content scrolls, sidebar and header stay fixed
pageWithSidebarHeaderContentScrollable.htmlExample: Header
whenToUse: When sidebar navigation must always be visible
pageWithSidebarHeaderContentScrollable.importantNotes: Sidebar uses border-brandcolor-strokestrong (strong border). Only main content area scrolls.

whenToUseContainer.description: Use container class when content should be centered with max-width
examples: Main content: container mx-auto px-4 py-8

whenNotToUseContainer.description: Don't use container for full-width elements
examples: Header: No container, use px-4 or px-6 for padding
Full-width background: No container, let it span full width

containerWithPadding.description: Always add horizontal padding with container
containerWithPadding.logic: Container centers content but doesn't add padding. Always add px-4 or px-6 for mobile spacing.

whenToUseGrid.description: Use CSS Grid for 2D layouts (rows and columns)
whenToUse: When you need both row and column control
examples: Card grid: grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 gap-6

whenToUseFlexbox.description: Use Flexbox for 1D layouts (row or column)

whenToUseColumns.description: Use Tailwind columns for text content
whenToUse: When text should flow in columns

whenToUseTable.description: Use HTML table elements for semantic data tables
whenToUse: Data that has rows and columns relationship
When screen readers need table semantics
examples: Financial report: Use <table> with <th> for headers
Comparison table: Use <table> for structured data
whenToUseTable.accessibility: Always use <thead>, <tbody>, <th> for headers, scope attributes for accessibility

whenNotToUseTable.description: Don't use table for layout - use Grid or Flexbox instead
examples: Card grid: Use grid, NOT table
Form layout: Use flexbox or grid, NOT table

divsInTables.description: When to use divs inside table cells
whenToUse: When you need complex styling inside a cell
When you need flexbox/grid inside a cell
When cell content needs multiple elements
For better control over cell content layout
whenNotToUse: Simple text content (just use text directly in <td>)

padding.description: Use padding for internal spacing within an element

margin.description: Use margin for external spacing between elements
whenToUse: Space between buttons in a group

gap.description: Use gap with flexbox or grid (RECOMMENDED)

space.description: Use space-x or space-y for spacing between children

whenToUse: Headers that must always be visible
fixed.zIndex: Always use z-50 or higher for fixed headers to stay above content

whenToUse: Headers that should scroll then stick
When you want natural scroll then stick

absolute.description: Positioned relative to nearest positioned ancestor
absolute.zIndex: Use appropriate z-index (z-10, z-20, z-30) based on layer

simpleHeader.structure: Logo | Navigation

headerWithButtons.structure:
Icon/Logo
Buttons

header.borderRule: Header borders: Use border-brandcolor-strokeweak for bottom border

fixedSidebar.structure: <aside class="flex-shrink-0 w-64 bg-brandcolor-white border-r border-brandcolor-strokestrong">Sidebar content</aside>

sidebar.borderRule: Sidebar borders: ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokestrong for right border (strong border for visibility)

scrollableContent.structure: Content

mainContent.backgroundRule: Scrollable content areas: Use bg-brandcolor-fill for background

simpleFooter.structure: Footer content

footer.borderRule: Footer borders: Use border-brandcolor-strokeweak for top border

workflow: 1. Read layout-guide.json to understand layout patterns
2. Read theme-guide.json for color and component styling
3. Determine page type based on requirements
4. Use appropriate layout method (flexbox grow, sticky, fixed)
5. Apply container rules (when to use, when not to use)
6. Choose grid vs flexbox based on layout needs
7. Follow spacing rules (padding vs margin, gap vs space)
8. Use positioning appropriately (fixed, sticky, absolute, relative)
9. Combine with theme utility classes from theme-guide.json

pageTypeSelection.rule: ALWAYS determine page type first before creating layout
options: pageWithHeaderContentScrollable - Header fixed, content scrolls (RECOMMENDED for apps)
pageWithHeaderFullPageScrolls - Sticky header, full page scrolls
pageTypeSelection.decisionTree: Ask: Does header need to stay visible? → Yes: Use flexbox grow. Does sidebar exist? → Yes: Use sidebar layout. Is it a simple page? → Yes: Use simple header layout.

containerUsage.rule: NEVER use container on full-width elements (headers, sidebars, backgrounds)
containerUsage.rule2: ALWAYS use container mx-auto px-4 for main content areas

wrong: Header with container (header should be full-width)
Sidebar with container (sidebar should be full-width)
correct: Header: No container, use px-4 for padding
Main content: container mx-auto px-4 py-8

gridVsFlexbox.rule: Use Grid for 2D layouts (rows AND columns), Flexbox for 1D layouts (row OR column)
gridVsFlexbox.decisionTree: Need both row and column control? → Grid. Need horizontal or vertical alignment? → Flexbox. Is it tabular data? → Table.

tableUsage.rule: ONLY use <table> for semantic tabular data, NEVER for layout

spacingConsistency.rule: Use gap with flexbox/grid (preferred), margin for external spacing, padding for internal spacing

rules: CRITICAL: Determine page type FIRST (pageWithHeader, pageWithHeaderContentScrollable, etc.)
CRITICAL: For app-like interfaces, use flexbox grow method (h-screen flex flex-col)
CRITICAL: Sidebar borders use border-brandcolor-strokestrong (strong border)
CRITICAL: Never use container on full-width elements (headers, sidebars)
CRITICAL: Always use container mx-auto px-4 for main content areas
Use Grid for 2D layouts (card grids, dashboards)
Use Flexbox for 1D layouts (navigation, vertical stacks, alignment)
Use Table ONLY for semantic tabular data, NEVER for layout
Use gap with flexbox/grid (preferred over space-x/space-y)
Use padding for internal spacing, margin for external spacing
Fixed headers: Use z-50 or higher
Scrollable content areas: Use bg-brandcolor-fill for background
Always combine layout classes with theme utility classes from theme-guide.json

pageCreationWorkflow.step1: Identify page type: pageWithHeader, pageWithHeaderContentScrollable, pageWithHeaderFullPageScrolls, or pageWithSidebarHeaderContentScrollable
pageCreationWorkflow.step2: Use the HTML example from pageTypes section as base structure
pageCreationWorkflow.step3: Apply theme utility classes from theme-guide.json for colors and components
pageCreationWorkflow.step4: Add container where appropriate (main content, not headers/sidebars)
pageCreationWorkflow.step5: Choose grid or flexbox based on layout needs
pageCreationWorkflow.step6: Apply spacing using gap (preferred) or margin/padding
pageCreationWorkflow.step7: Ensure proper z-index for fixed/sticky elements
pageCreationWorkflow.step8: Test scroll behavior matches page type requirements

importantNotes.flexboxGrowMethod: RECOMMENDED for app-like interfaces. Header stays fixed, only content scrolls. Use: h-screen flex flex-col, header: flex-shrink-0, main: flex-1 overflow-y-auto
importantNotes.sidebarBorder: Sidebar borders MUST use border-brandcolor-strokestrong (strong border for visibility), NOT border-brandcolor-strokeweak
importantNotes.headerBorder: Header borders use border-brandcolor-strokeweak (weak border for subtle separation)
importantNotes.containerRule: Container centers content but doesn't add padding. Always add px-4 or px-6 for mobile spacing: container mx-auto px-4
importantNotes.scrollableBackground: Scrollable content areas should use bg-brandcolor-fill for consistent background
importantNotes.tableSemantics: Only use <table> for actual tabular data. For layouts, use grid or flexbox. Screen readers depend on proper table semantics.

beforeCreatingPage: Check: What is the page type? (pageWithHeader, pageWithHeaderContentScrollable, etc.)
Check: Is container used correctly? (Not on headers/sidebars, yes on main content)
Check: Is grid/flexbox chosen correctly? (Grid for 2D, flexbox for 1D)
Check: Are spacing rules followed? (gap for flex/grid, margin for external, padding for internal)
Check: Are borders using correct theme colors? (strokestrong for sidebar, strokeweak for header/cards)
Verify: Scroll behavior matches page type requirements
Verify: All layout classes combined with theme utility classes

validationChecklist.pageType: Page type identified and correct structure used
validationChecklist.containerUsage: Container used only on main content, not on full-width elements
validationChecklist.gridFlexbox: Grid used for 2D layouts, flexbox for 1D layouts
validationChecklist.tableUsage: Table used only for semantic data, not for layout
validationChecklist.spacing: Gap used with flex/grid, proper margin/padding usage
validationChecklist.borders: Correct border colors (strokestrong for sidebar, strokeweak for header/cards)
validationChecklist.scrollBehavior: Scroll behavior matches page type (content scrolls vs full page scrolls)
validationChecklist.themeClasses: Theme utility classes from theme-guide.json applied correctly
